meanings.definition: A person or thing that flows together with another.
meanings.sent1: The confluents of creativity and passion led to a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: The confluents of different cultures in the city created a vibrant community.
meanings.sent3: The confluents of laughter and joy danced around the room.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like the confluents of two rivers, strong and unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The confluents of hard work and determination paved the way to success.

meanings.definition: A stream or river flowing into another.
meanings.sent1: The small creek was one of the confluents that fed into the main river.
meanings.sent2: The confluents joined together to form a mighty river that carved through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The confluents rushed eagerly to meet the larger river, like children running to play.
meanings.sent4: The confluents embraced each other, their waters blending seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The confluents merged gracefully, their union a natural wonder to behold.
